loginAndRegister.CAS: is the Central Authentication Service for UGent. CAS allows you to log on to secured UGent pages using your UGent account or external account. CAS provides Single Sign-On (SSO) capabilities: you only have to log on once to gain access to several UGent web applications.
loginAndRegister.errorContent: Either no user with the given email could be found, or the password you gave was wrong. Please check the email and try again.
loginAndRegister.userAlreadyExists: Couldn't register. There already exists an account with this email. Pleas try again with a different email address!
loginAndRegister.casWarning: Students of Ghent University must login using CAS. They cannot register.
loginAndRegister.instructions:
Only students connected to the association AUGent can register for this site. To verify that you
are actually a student, we need access to some basic information. Therefore you need to give
permission to share your data with Ghent University, prior to registering.
loginAndRegister.emailInstruction: Use the full, long version of the email address of your institution.
loginAndRegister.emailNotRecognizedByLdap: The server could not verify the given email address ({{email}}). Make sure that you are using the email address of your institution and that your institution is part of the Association UGent.
loginAndRegister.emailAlreadyLinkedToAccount: An account with email address {{email}} already exists.
loginAndRegister.ugentUserMustUseCAS: {{email}} belongs to a UGhent account. You must use CAS instead.
loginAndRegister.about: The digital platform for study locations

information.lead: During the study period the Therminal, Kantienberg and S5 are held open as a place to study. Registering is mandatory and happens every Sunday evening for the upcoming week.
information.locationsContent:
Registrations for the Therminal open every Sunday at 7 pm.

Registrations for S5 open every Sunday at 7.30 pm.

Registrations for Kantienberg open every Sunday at 8 pm.
information.rulesContent:
Between 8.30 and 9 am only people with a registration are allowed. From 9 am onwards everyone is welcome.

Community college students (Artevelde and HoGent) are only allowed during weekends and holidays.

A readable barcode on your student ID is essential, damaged or unreadable barcodes can not be used. Damaged UGent student cards are eligible for free replacement in the UFO. As a backup, your barcode can be generated and printed on the barcode page that is linked in the reservationform.

It is prohibited to hold space for other persons. Between 8.50 am and 9.05 am checks may occur. Books occupying spots where no student is seated are considered to be a violation of this rule and will be removed. They can be retrieved from the student administrator by appointment.
It is prohibited to have other people use your barcode/reservation.
Automating the registration process is strictly forbidden.
Communication will happen in the Facebook groups.

Blok@ is organised by volunteers and with materials that Ghent University provides to these volunteers free of charge. Please be respectful for their efforts and the material.
Violating these house rules can be punished with penalty points up to permanent blacklisting for all involved.

calendarOverview.immediateOpenClose: You can immediatly open or close reservations for the selected day(s) with the following buttons
calendarOverview.pastDaySelected: You cannot change the opening hours of a day that has already passed. Please select a future date.

A problem occurred while verifying your account. 
This could be because you are trying to verify your account a second time.

help.managementLead: Only admins and employees can see the management pages. They can add, delete and change users, locations and lockers. Admins have more possibilities than employees.
help.managementUsers:
Here the employees and admins can search for specific users, based on name, student ID or email and filter them by institution. They can change the student's number when pressing on the 'Edit' button. The student can then download this new barcode on his profile page. By clicking on 'manage penalties' in the 'edit user' pop-up, penalties can be added, deleted or changed. Normally this all happens automatically, the functionality of managing the penalties was added to give some flexibility. When adding a penalty the field 'timestamp', should be the moment the violation was made and the field 'For date' is the date from the reservation which was violated. For instance if I'm canceling my reservation for monday on sunday evening, the 'timestamp' will be sunday and the 'for date' will be monday. 

An admin has more possibility's, he can add a new user and change the roles of an existing user. A user can combine two roles, this way it's possible to be a student and make own reservations while also being an employee. Only the admin can make someone an employee. Click on the + sign to add a second role, and on the - to delete this second role.
help.managementLocation:
Here the employees can see an overview of the different locations, but can't do anything with the data. 
Admins can change the properties of existing locations, delete locations or add a new location. They must also assign employees to the different locations. An employee can only scan at locations he is assigned to.
help.managementLocationreservations: Here you can find an overview of the different reservations, based on location, student ID or name of a student. The results can be filtered on date, name and location.
help.managementLockerreservations: Here you can find an overview of the different reservations, based on location, student ID or name of a student. The results can be filtered on date, name and location.
help.managementLockers:
Here you can see all the lockers on specific locations. You are only able to see the locations you are assigned to. An admin can assign employees to locations in the locations tab of the management page. 
The lockers have long reservation periods, when a student reserves a locker, it's instantly for a longer period of time. But he is free to stop the reservation any time.
help.managementLocationCalendar:
Here the opening times of the specific locations can be configured. When the opening times of consecutive days have the same opening hours, it's easier to use the bottommost form. To set only one day, select this in the calendar.
The timing that the reservations open for specific days and locations can also be set in the 'Reservations open' fields. When for instance the reservation for monday-friday must open on sunday, use the lower from.

Again the employees can only configure locations they are assigned to.
help.managementPenalties:
Here the employees can see all the different reasons a student can receive penalty points. Students can see a overview of these events on their help page, when you don't want them to be able to see certain events then you should uncheck the 'show' option.
An admin can change the penalty and add a new one. You can't change the code of penalties which have a code starting with 1666.
help.scanning:
On the scanpage the employee must first select a location. This must be the location he or she is located at at the moment. When you can't see the location that you need, ask the admin to assign you to that location.

After you have selected a location and pressed open location, a new button will appear to open the scanpage for students. This is the page where students can scan their barcode. Open this page visible to the students and make sure it has focus when you want the scanning to start. If this is the case the scanner should read the students barcode and try to mark him/her as attended automatically.

During the scanning you can view which students are present or absent and manually change the status of a student ( e.g. put an absent student as present or vice versa ). However please note that this will cause the scanpage for students to lose focus so only do this at a moment where students can't scan or at the end of the scanning session.

If you decide students can no longer scan, you can press the close location button, after this you will see three new buttons:
-Cancel scanning : this is used in case scanning has gone wrong and will mark all students as attended.
-Send mails: this will send a mail to all absent students to tell them they were absent.
-Assign penaltypoints: this will assign penalty points to all absent students for being absent.
help.referToScan: Go to management -> help -> scan for more info.
help.profileLead: On the profile pages you can manage all your own information and reservations.
help.profile: On the profile tab you can see the information this application has about you. When you can't change anything it's because this information is linked with the information from your institution.
help.profileLocationRes: Here you can see all your reservations, for past and upcoming dates. You can cancel the upcoming ones, when this will add penalty points you will get a warning before cancelling. These points are calculated in function of the time until the reservation. If you cancel several days before the reservation, no points will be assigned. The 'Opening Hours' are from the location on the day of your reservation. You can make location reservations on the 'Dashboard', the reservations open on specific days, these can differ. There will be a countdown visible on the location's page when the opening of the reservations approaches.
help.profileLockerRes:
Here you can see the status from your locker reservations. 
Lockers aren't present at every location. If there are, then you can reserve them on the specific page of the location, reachable via 'Dashboard'. After making a reservation you must fetch the key.
help.profileCalendar: Here you can see a visual representation of all your location reservations, interesting!
help.profilePenalties:
This is an overview of all your actions that caused penalty points being added. The maximum for this is {{points}}, so when you have more, you can't make any reservation. Lucky for you the penalty points aren't forever and decrease over time. 
Below you see a table with all possible reasons for receiving them.
Note that the points for canceling too late are a maximum, when canceling at a more reasonable time, less points will be added.
